intro: Ophiorrhiza brunonis, commonly known as the Malayan threadleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its slender, often twisted stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Ophiorrhiza brunonis is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils.
